instruction: Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
Add the onion, leeks, fennel, and garlic. Saut√© until softened and translucent, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the tomatoes, bay leaf, thyme, saffron threads (if using), and orange zest (if using). Cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in the clam juice or fish stock and water. Bring to a simmer and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Increase heat to medium-high. Add the fish and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the squid or crab (if using) and mussels or clams. Simmer for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the mussels or clams have opened and the fish is cooked through.
Shrimp can be added during the last 2-3 minutes of cooking, if using.
Serve immediately in bowls with the flavorful broth and seafood. Rouille (a spicy breadcrumb spread) can be served on the side for dipping (optional).
